result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Barry Jay Goeden was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash Bond previously posted in the amount of $850.00 has been applied.  The remaining balance is  to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Huber Privileges and Good Time granted.    Court has no objection to sentence being served in another jurisdiction provided the Defendant can make the appropriate arrangements.  The law requires that the decision concerning the use of electronic monitoring be made by the Sheriff of the jail at which the sentence is served.
Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.
Same repayment provisions apply as noted above for the fine.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 3:29 PM: Defendant Barry Jay Goeden in court with attorney Travis Thomas Schreurs.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Resolution recited by ADA.  Def and counsel concur with State's recital.  Joint recommendation on resolution as per guidelines.  Defendant understands that sentence must commence today.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Meds serving no impairment on proceeding today.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Def agrees with 2 prior convictions as recited by Court.   Plea (OWI 3):  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Ct 2 dismissed outright.  15TR-215 and 15TR-216 DRI.  Statement by Def:  None offered.  The Court:  Will accept recommendation of counsel.  Imposes:  90 days WCJ - Commence forthwith and report promptly, Huber and GT, 1 day TS credit; $3214 fine, plus $42.50 Blood Draw Fee - bond to apply - 60 DTP or PP; 33 Mos DL Rev effective today with credit or any Adm Suspension; IID for 33 mos effective today; OWI Assessment prior to relicensing; No objection to transfer of SEH to Milwaukee Co if arrangements can be made; No authority to order EMD - solely up to the Jail rules where sentence is served.  No DNA sample to be provided - Surcharge assessed including in fine/costs. Appeal Rights Given.
